About me

I am a interaction designer and developer, who is extremely enthusiastic about the blockchain ecosystem and smart contracts. I work with Front-End technologies - such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript. I am constantly learning frontend and blockchain technologies, such as Solidity, to understand secure smart contracts and the grow as a fullstack developer.

I enjoy building websites for creatives, friends and family, and as a freelancer. Establishing a digital presence in modern society is crucial to marketing your brand or oneself, so I plan to help those in need and create digital voice's for those who do not have.

View Resume

Projects

Portfolio Wesbite

This was a project for a 3rd year student, who is a photographer and animator. He wanted a portfolio website, in which he could showcase his photography collections as well as a few portraits - which were animated self portraits. This was a fun project, with the client having awesome photography and animations - making the overall experience a interesting and great one. This project was built using HTML and CSS, making use of CSS animations to make it slightly more dynamic.

See Live Source Code

DeFi Application

This was a personal project that allowed me to get my foot into the door of Decentralised Finance (DeFi) applications. This consisted of building a Decentralised Exchange application, that allowed for the user to stake and unstake their coins into a liquidity pool. This helped become familiar with Solidity - a smart contract language for the Ethereum blockchain - and allowed me to become slightly familiar with using middleware to connect your smart contract to a front end. It was built using Solidity, Web3.js and React - implementing end to end development.

Source Code

Rock, Paper, Sciscors

This was one of my first projects building something with the use of JavaScript with HTML and CSS. It helped me improve and develop my logical thinking and programmatic thinking. Images were incorporated within the project, with there being a user and a CPU, with the userâ€™s turn being generated through what the user selects in the interface and the computer's turn being generated through a random math function - which randomly generates a return value between 1 and 3, return either rock, paper or scissors, depending on the value.

See Live Source Code

Frontend Application

This was a remote internship project for Code Capsules, a software company based in Cape Town. The project consisted of building a frontend application, that allowed the admins of the application to set the status of their current projects. Reactjs was used to build the UI, with Nextjs being integrated at a later stage, to implement and build a fullstack application for the company.

Source Code

Wedding Invitation

This was a project for a couple who were getting married. They wanted a website which was able to showcase their bold stance for their love, and to share the invitation with their loved ones abroad. I throroughly enjoyed this project as their excitement for their site and their wedding, made the process easy and greatly effective. This project consisted of the use of HTML, CSS - with the use of Bootstrap - and JavaScript.

See Live Source Code

Boss Boys Platters

This was a project for a catering company, called Boss Boys. The business wanted a website, where they were able to showcase their menu, what they offer and have a way for people to get in touch with them. This project consisted of the use of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. JS third party libraries were used in order to execute the slider and isotope interactions.
